thread.title: Travellers told to expect Eurotunnel delays after migrants storm...
thread.title_full: Travellers told to expect Eurotunnel delays after migrants storm...

author: WMNBillMartin
title: Travellers told to expect Eurotunnel delays after migrants storm...
text:
Travellers told to expect Eurotunnel delays after migrants storm terminal By WMNBillMartin | Posted: October 19, 2015 Travellers told to expect Eurotunnel delays after migrants storm terminal X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Eurotunnel was forced to suspend cross-Channel services in both directions after hundreds of migrants stormed the terminal and platforms in France. 
The mass intrusion overnight led the Channel Tunnel operator to temporarily halt services from Folkestone, Kent, and Coquelles in northern France. 
A Eurotunnel spokesman said migrants were using diversionary tactics to occupy police to allow others to try to make a bid to cross the Channel. 
He said: “They are coming in waves to occupy the police, then another wave comes, then another, until there is no more police. One group is then able to get through. 
“Then we have to take over and sweep through the terminal and clear them all from the tracks and the platform.” 
Passenger services have resumed but travellers were warned to expect delays. The spokesman said they were starting to get freight traffic moving as well. 
It emerged at the weekend that the number of migrants living in makeshift camps outside Calais has now reached 6,000. 
The numbers have been boosted as the crisis in Calais is part of a wider migrant surge in to Europe from countries in North Africa and the Middle East. 
At least 15 migrants have died in or near the tunnel since the start of the cross-Channel migrant crisis at the beginning of the summer. 
The surge in migrants attempting to cross the Channel prompted a string of measures to increase security at the terminal, including extra fencing and the deployment of more border force search and dog teams.
